title: Components
content:
Components
Primer Components are reusable, interactive building blocks for designing consistent user interfaces. They include elements for actions, containment, communication, navigation, selection, and text input, ensuring a cohesive and accessible design across applications. Each component is designed to be flexible and can be seamlessly integrated into various projects to enhance functionality and user experience.
ActionBar
A collection of horizontally aligned IconButtons. The IconButtons can be split into groups by adding a divider. When there is not enough space, IconButtons that don't fit will be added to an overflow menu.
Learn more
ActionList
ActionList is a vertical list of interactive actions or options. It's composed of items presented in a consistent, single-column format, with room for icons, descriptions, side information, and other rich visuals.
Learn more
ActionMenu
ActionMenu is composed of ActionList and Overlay patterns used for quick actions and selections.
Learn more
AnchoredOverlay
AnchoredOverlay opens an Overlay relative to the anchor position.
Learn more
Autocomplete
Autocomplete allows users to quickly filter through a list of options and pick one or more values for a field.
Learn more
Avatar
Avatar is an image that represents a user or organization.
Learn more
AvatarStack
AvatarStack displays two or more Avatars in an inline stack.
Learn more
Banner
Banner is used to highlight important information.
Learn more
Blankslate
Blankslate is used as placeholder to tell users why content is missing.
Learn more
BranchName
BranchName is a label-type component rendered as an <a> tag by default that displays the name of a branch.
Learn more
Breadcrumbs
Breadcrumbs display the current page or context within the site, allowing them to navigate different levels of the hierarchy.
Learn more
Button
Button is used to initiate actions on a page or form.
Learn more
ButtonGroup
ButtonGroup renders a series of buttons.
Learn more
Checkbox
Checkbox is a form control for single and multiple selections.
Learn more
CheckboxGroup
CheckboxGroup renders a set of Checkboxes.
Learn more
CircleBadge
CircleBadge visually connects logos of third-party services, eg. in the marketplace.
Learn more
ConfirmationDialog
ConfirmationDialog is a specialized dialog component used to confirm user actions. It provides a simple way to ask users to confirm or cancel potentially destructive or important actions.
Learn more
CounterLabel
Adds a count to navigational elements and buttons.
Learn more
DataTable
DataTable is a 2-dimensional data structure where each row is an item, and each column is a data point about the item.
Learn more
Details
Details is a styled component to enhance the native behaviors of the <details> element.
Learn more
Dialog
Dialog is a floating surface used to display transient content such as confirmation actions, selection options, and more.
Learn more
FormControl
FormControl displays a labelled input and, optionally, associated validation text and/or hint text.
Learn more
Heading
Heading defines the hierarchical structure and importance of the content they contain.
Learn more
IconButton
IconButton is used for buttons that show an icon in place of a text label.
Learn more
InlineMessage
InlineMessage is used to inform the user about the result of an action within the content.
Learn more
Label
Use the label component to add contextual metadata to a design.
Learn more
LabelGroup
Use LabelGroup to add commonly used margins and other layout constraints to groups of Labels
Learn more
Link
Links are used to apply styles to hyperlink text.
Learn more
NavList
NavList renders a vertical list of navigation links.
Learn more
Overlay
Overlay components codify design patterns related to floating surfaces such as Dialogs and menus.
Learn more
PageHeader
PageHeader determines the top-level headings of a UI.
Learn more
PageLayout
PageLayout defines the header, main, pane, and footer areas of a page.
Learn more
Pagination
Pagination is a horizontal set of links to navigate paginated content.
Learn more
Popover
Popover is used to bring attention to specific user interface elements.
Learn more
ProgressBar
A ProgressBar is a simple chart that can be used to show how complete something is, or visualize parts that make up a whole.
Learn more
Radio
Radio button is a form control for making a single selection from a short list of options.
Learn more
RadioGroup
RadioGroup is used to render a short list of mutually exclusive options.
Learn more
RelativeTime
RelativeTime displays time in a way that is clear, concise, and accessible.
Learn more
SegmentedControl
SegmentedControl is used to pick one choice from a linear set of closely related choices, and immediately apply that selection.
Learn more
Select
Select is for choosing a single option from a dropdown menu of predefined choices.
Learn more
SelectPanel
The SelectPanel is an anchored dialog that allows users to quickly navigate and select one or multiple items from a list. It includes a text input for filtering, supports item grouping, and offers a footer for additional actions. Changes are applied upon closing the panel.
Learn more
Skeleton loaders
Replaces content while it's in a loading state.
Learn more
Spinner
A Spinner is an indeterminate loading indicator, ideal for processes with unknown or variable durations.
Learn more
SplitPageLayout
SplitPageLayout is a layout component that allows you to create a two-column layout with a main content area and a sidebar.
Learn more
Stack
Stack is a layout component that creates responsive horizontal and vertical flows.
Learn more
StateLabel
StateLabel is used for rendering the status of an issue or pull request.
Learn more
Text
An abstraction for using Primer's typographic styles.
Learn more
Textarea
Textarea is used to set a value that is multiple lines of text.
Learn more
TextInput
TextInput is used to set a value that is a single line of text.
Learn more
TextInputWithTokens
TextInputWithTokens is an input for a value that is a list.
Learn more
Timeline
The Timeline component is used to display items on a vertical Timeline, connected by Timeline elements.
Learn more
ToggleSwitch
ToggleSwitch is used to immediately toggle a setting on or off.
Learn more
Token
Token is a compact representation of an object, and is typically used to show a collection of related metadata.
Learn more
Tooltip
Tooltips add additional context to interactive UI elements and appear on mouse hover or keyboard focus.
Learn more
TreeView
TreeView is a hierarchical list of items that may have a parent-child relationship where children can be toggled into view by expanding or collapsing their parent item.
Learn more
Truncate
Use Truncate to shorten overflowing text with an ellipsis.
Learn more
UnderlineNav
The UnderlineNav is used to display navigation in a horizontal tabbed format.
Learn more
UnderlinePanels
The UnderlinePanels are used to break related content into tabbed panels.
Learn more
content_markdown:
# Components

Primer Components are reusable, interactive building blocks for designing consistent user interfaces. They include elements for actions, containment, communication, navigation, selection, and text input, ensuring a cohesive and accessible design across applications. Each component is designed to be flexible and can be seamlessly integrated into various projects to enhance functionality and user experience.

## [ActionBar](/product/components/action-bar)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3436-2961.png)

A collection of horizontally aligned IconButtons. The IconButtons can be split into groups by adding a divider. When there is not enough space, IconButtons that don't fit will be added to an overflow menu.

Learn more

## [ActionList](/product/components/action-list)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3436-3039.png)

ActionList is a vertical list of interactive actions or options. It's composed of items presented in a consistent, single-column format, with room for icons, descriptions, side information, and other rich visuals.

Learn more

## [ActionMenu](/product/components/action-menu)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3436-3809.png)

ActionMenu is composed of ActionList and Overlay patterns used for quick actions and selections.

Learn more

## [AnchoredOverlay](/product/components/anchored-overlay)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3612-2403.png)

AnchoredOverlay opens an Overlay relative to the anchor position.

Learn more

## [Autocomplete](/product/components/autocomplete)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3436-5979.png)

Autocomplete allows users to quickly filter through a list of options and pick one or more values for a field.

Learn more

## [Avatar](/product/components/avatar)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3436-6022.png)

Avatar is an image that represents a user or organization.

Learn more

## [AvatarStack](/product/components/avatar-stack)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3612-2429.png)

AvatarStack displays two or more Avatars in an inline stack.

Learn more

## [Banner](/product/components/banner)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3436-7689.png)

Banner is used to highlight important information.

Learn more

## [Blankslate](/product/components/blankslate)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3436-7771.png)

Blankslate is used as placeholder to tell users why content is missing.

Learn more

## [BranchName](/product/components/branch-name)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3612-2421.png)

BranchName is a label-type component rendered as an <a> tag by default that displays the name of a branch.

Learn more

## [Breadcrumbs](/product/components/breadcrumbs)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3448-12203.png)

Breadcrumbs display the current page or context within the site, allowing them to navigate different levels of the hierarchy.

Learn more

## [Button](/product/components/button)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3436-8220.png)

Button is used to initiate actions on a page or form.

Learn more

## [ButtonGroup](/product/components/button-group)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3436-11168.png)

ButtonGroup renders a series of buttons.

Learn more

## [Checkbox](/product/components/checkbox)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3612-2435.png)

Checkbox is a form control for single and multiple selections.

Learn more

## [CheckboxGroup](/product/components/checkbox-group)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3448-12222.png)

CheckboxGroup renders a set of Checkboxes.

Learn more

## [CircleBadge](/product/components/circle-badge)

CircleBadge visually connects logos of third-party services, eg. in the marketplace.

Learn more

## [ConfirmationDialog](/product/components/confirmation-dialog)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3448-12279.png)

ConfirmationDialog is a specialized dialog component used to confirm user actions. It provides a simple way to ask users to confirm or cancel potentially destructive or important actions.

Learn more

## [CounterLabel](/product/components/counter-label)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3612-2450.png)

Adds a count to navigational elements and buttons.

Learn more

## [DataTable](/product/components/data-table)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3448-15394.png)

DataTable is a 2-dimensional data structure where each row is an item, and each column is a data point about the item.

Learn more

## [Details](/product/components/details)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3612-2441.png)

Details is a styled component to enhance the native behaviors of the <details> element.

Learn more

## [Dialog](/product/components/dialog)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3448-12279.png)

Dialog is a floating surface used to display transient content such as confirmation actions, selection options, and more.

Learn more

## [FormControl](/product/components/form-control)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3612-2458.png)

FormControl displays a labelled input and, optionally, associated validation text and/or hint text.

Learn more

## [Heading](/product/components/heading)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3612-2456.png)

Heading defines the hierarchical structure and importance of the content they contain.

Learn more

## [IconButton](/product/components/icon-button)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3448-12285.png)

IconButton is used for buttons that show an icon in place of a text label.

Learn more

## [InlineMessage](/product/components/inline-message)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3448-12297.png)

InlineMessage is used to inform the user about the result of an action within the content.

Learn more

## [Label](/product/components/label)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3448-12291.png)

Use the label component to add contextual metadata to a design.

Learn more

## [LabelGroup](/product/components/label-group)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3448-18757.png)

Use LabelGroup to add commonly used margins and other layout constraints to groups of Labels

Learn more

## [Link](/product/components/link)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3448-18759.png)

Links are used to apply styles to hyperlink text.

Learn more

## [NavList](/product/components/nav-list)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3448-18769.png)

NavList renders a vertical list of navigation links.

Learn more

## [Overlay](/product/components/overlay)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3612-2452.png)

Overlay components codify design patterns related to floating surfaces such as Dialogs and menus.

Learn more

## [PageHeader](/product/components/page-header)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3612-2461.png)

PageHeader determines the top-level headings of a UI.

Learn more

## [PageLayout](/product/components/page-layout)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3612-2454.png)

PageLayout defines the header, main, pane, and footer areas of a page.

Learn more

## [Pagination](/product/components/pagination)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3448-18764.png)

Pagination is a horizontal set of links to navigate paginated content.

Learn more

## [Popover](/product/components/popover)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3612-2467.png)

Popover is used to bring attention to specific user interface elements.

Learn more

## [ProgressBar](/product/components/progress-bar)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3453-5173.png)

A ProgressBar is a simple chart that can be used to show how complete something is, or visualize parts that make up a whole.

Learn more

## [Radio](/product/components/radio)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3453-5190.png)

Radio button is a form control for making a single selection from a short list of options.

Learn more

## [RadioGroup](/product/components/radio-group)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3453-5675.png)

RadioGroup is used to render a short list of mutually exclusive options.

Learn more

## [RelativeTime](/product/components/relative-time)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3463-2503.png)

RelativeTime displays time in a way that is clear, concise, and accessible.

Learn more

## [SegmentedControl](/product/components/segmented-control)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3463-2537.png)

SegmentedControl is used to pick one choice from a linear set of closely related choices, and immediately apply that selection.

Learn more

## [Select](/product/components/select)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3463-3841.png)

Select is for choosing a single option from a dropdown menu of predefined choices.

Learn more

## [SelectPanel](/product/components/select-panel)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3463-4890.png)

The SelectPanel is an anchored dialog that allows users to quickly navigate and select one or multiple items from a list. It includes a text input for filtering, supports item grouping, and offers a footer for additional actions. Changes are applied upon closing the panel.

Learn more

## [Skeleton loaders](/product/components/skeleton-loaders)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3463-41394.png)

Replaces content while it's in a loading state.

Learn more

## [Spinner](/product/components/spinner)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3463-41833.png)

A Spinner is an indeterminate loading indicator, ideal for processes with unknown or variable durations.

Learn more

## [SplitPageLayout](/product/components/split-page-layout)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3612-2432.png)

SplitPageLayout is a layout component that allows you to create a two-column layout with a main content area and a sidebar.

Learn more

## [Stack](/product/components/stack)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3463-41889.png)

Stack is a layout component that creates responsive horizontal and vertical flows.

Learn more

## [StateLabel](/product/components/state-label)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3463-41907.png)

StateLabel is used for rendering the status of an issue or pull request.

Learn more

## [Text](/product/components/text)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3463-42082.png)

An abstraction for using Primer's typographic styles.

Learn more

## [Textarea](/product/components/textarea)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3464-4421.png)

Textarea is used to set a value that is multiple lines of text.

Learn more

## [TextInput](/product/components/text-input)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3463-42127.png)

TextInput is used to set a value that is a single line of text.

Learn more

## [TextInputWithTokens](/product/components/text-input-with-tokens)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3463-42487.png)

TextInputWithTokens is an input for a value that is a list.

Learn more

## [Timeline](/product/components/timeline)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3464-4571.png)

The Timeline component is used to display items on a vertical Timeline, connected by Timeline elements.

Learn more

## [ToggleSwitch](/product/components/toggle-switch)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3464-5434.png)

ToggleSwitch is used to immediately toggle a setting on or off.

Learn more

## [Token](/product/components/token)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3464-5885.png)

Token is a compact representation of an object, and is typically used to show a collection of related metadata.

Learn more

## [Tooltip](/product/components/tooltip)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3464-14286.png)

Tooltips add additional context to interactive UI elements and appear on mouse hover or keyboard focus.

Learn more

## [TreeView](/product/components/tree-view)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3464-6299.png)

TreeView is a hierarchical list of items that may have a parent-child relationship where children can be toggled into view by expanding or collapsing their parent item.

Learn more

## [Truncate](/product/components/truncate)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3464-15228.png)

Use Truncate to shorten overflowing text with an ellipsis.

Learn more

## [UnderlineNav](/product/components/underline-nav)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3464-15235.png)

The UnderlineNav is used to display navigation in a horizontal tabbed format.

Learn more

## [UnderlinePanels](/product/components/underline-panels)

![](/images/figma/YlBTqHTbdRwYQt0bfIHvGw-3464-17036.png)

The UnderlinePanels are used to break related content into tabbed panels.

Learn more
